Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Nima
Reviews.Content: Birthday Present from my mom~ My very first personal camera (I usually use my aunt's canon) and I love it! I'm not a professional photographer but this camera takes really crisp pictures! Zoom is pretty good and the face tracking is really accurate~ Pixels are not all mashed up when you zoom in it warns you when you zoom in too much and you notice the increasing blurriness of the photo. Pictures in low light look really good also as though there was a light source present. I have yet to experiment much with the videos but it from the little videos i've shot, the video is pretty clear.The fact that I don't have to go mad looking for AA or AAA batteries is a SUPER PLUS! Miss perfect picture moments because of batteries and nobody loves that~  You do have to buy a memory card because the camera doesn't come with one.Terrific camera! I don't know how much she paid for the camera so I cannot comment on the price.

Reviews.Title: SLOW Entry Level Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Boss
Reviews.Content: I picked up the S3300 at a Sam's Club because my S8000 started acting up while on vacation. I thought by staying in the Nikon family, all would be well.  Big mistake!!!  The extra $100 to get you into the next class of cameras is well worth it if you are more than the occasional photographer.CONSIt's S-L-O-W.  Painfully slow....so slow, that I returned it and got my money back.It's slow (and difficult) to get all 9 focus boxes to appear for a crisp clear picture.It's slow to save the picture to the SD Card (class 10)It's slow to transfer the pictures out of the camera to your computer (at least this can be fixed by taking out the SD Card and connecting it directly to your computer)30% of my pictures were blurry. Most likely because it takes forever to focus. I shot about 1000 pictures on my vacation.  30% (300) blurry photos, that's a lot.PRO'sAs crappy as the camera is to take a STILL picture, it takes great pictures while you're moving (go figure). It has a "sports" setting allowing you to take pictures of something that's moving, or from a moving car...and they look great!Being able to see the screen in bright daylight is also a big plus with Nikon cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great point & Shoot!
Reviews.Author: coolmomx2
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera yesterday and have been taking pictures in all different kinds of lighting.This camera has done great in even a dark room.I am very pleased with how quiet it is whichwill be great when shooting video's.Haven't been able to get a great super close up yet butI think that is due to my lack of understanding on just how to use all the functions of the camerajust yet.I'm not a professional photographer but as a capture every moment mom of two I havetaken thousands upon thousands of pictures.I've been through many camera's (Samsung,Kodak,Fuigi)to name a few none have come close to the quality of picture of this Nikon.I am very happywith this camera so far.I love how compact it is and the fun colors it comes in.

Reviews.Title: Superior Nikon Quality
Reviews.Author: Terry Schumacher
Reviews.Content: I have been a faithful Nikon Coolpix customer I have followed the product line all the way from the beginning, It is an excellent camera in the compact line. I love all the new features presented with this model. This item lives up to its description. I give Nikon an A plus for innovation and design. Thanks for introducing the rechargable battery.

Reviews.Title: Indestructible?
Reviews.Author: S. Salisbury
Reviews.Content: My mother bought this camera on Amazon for my 10-year old daughter for Christmas.  It seemed perfect for her - very slim and easy to operate.  My daughter loved it immediately.  Unfortunately she left it outside on our swingset ... for almost a week ... and it rained/snowed every day.  They only reason we found it is that it had sleeted/snowed one night, and the kids were out playing the next morning.  I heard my daughter WAILING as she discovered the camera.  It was frozen to the swingset, encased in ice.We brought it inside and packed it in uncooked rice (an old tech trick to dry out electronics) for the 1% chance it might still work.  I assumed that was the end of the story, and that we would call this an expensive lesson in taking care of your possessions.After several days, I pulled the camera out of the rice, popped the battery back in it, and TURNED IT ON!!!  It came on just as if it had been sitting in a drawer for a week, instead of outside in winter precipitation!  I proceeded to take several pictures and played with some settings and it worked fine.  There wasn't even any moisture inside the lens.  My daughter was absolutely thrilled and has been snapping photos ever since.So I have to give it to Nikon - they made one heck of a camera here.  It's good to know that something that is meant to be taken out into the world and used is sturdy and well made.

Reviews.Title: blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Upshifter
Reviews.Content: I bought a new Nikon S3300, but it was the worst small camera that I've ever had.  The pictures are blurry and have smeary artifacts.  I tried everything I could to get it to work right, even talked to other people.  Finally, disgusted, I wrote it up and sent it to Nikon's repair facility for repair.  It took 2 or 3 weeks turn around time.  They gave me a list of things they did to fix it.  It came back as blurry as it was when I sent it in.  I took it back to the dealer and got another camera.  I suppose some people will be satisfied with the S3300, but I'm not.

Reviews.Title: Great P-N-S for the money.
Reviews.Author: Nathan Holsopple
Reviews.Content: I was shopping for a camera at Best Buy and I came across this little gem for $80. Instant buy.The 6X optical zoom and image stabilization (digital zoom is relatively useless as it just pixelates your photo the more you zoom!) is extremely effective and can capture moving objects quite easily. At this price-point, I'd highly recommend this camera to casual photographers on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pocket Camera but died early
Reviews.Author: J. Mcclain "Grampa Joe"
Reviews.Content: I'm retired, so don't have a lot of money for a good camera, to replace my defunct old SLR film camera. I'm not very "techy", so it had to be easy to use, intuitive menus, and still produce quality images.  You can't do better for the money.  It's worth a lot more to me than what I paid for it.  Everyone raves about the picture quality, and I just run the images through PC Paint to reduce the size for emailing.  I've stopped using the flash at all, because the camera is fast enough to work without it, indoors or out.  I use it daily, just for fun, and it does wonderfully.Well, I took it out to use, and it would not focus, the gave a lens error, and is now nonfunctional as of Aug 6, 2013. Had hoped it would have lasted longer!

Reviews.Title: Quick, easy, nice pictures
Reviews.Author: Valerie G. Aarne "Valerie G.A. Grossman"
Reviews.Content: I have a very nice camera that I enjoy ... however it is hard to travel with.  I bought this camera to stick in my purse, so I could have a camera when I traveled.  It has now gone around the country with me and worked out quite well.  It takes nice pictures of people and nature.  The zoom works quite well.  Transferring pictures to my computer is easy.  I am very pleased with this camera. (and I struggle with technology ... but this is even easy for me!)

Reviews.Title: nikon digital camera
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: The camera is a compact camera.  The face recognition has trouble locking on in crowds.  I have more blurry pictures than clear ones if there is multiple people in the picture or any movement.  As long as theere is no movement or a couple people the picture is clear.

Reviews.Title: Wow! I'm super satisfied
Reviews.Author: Bill A. Holcombe "pethead"
Reviews.Content: I've been looking to replace my compact camera and finally decided on this one. Upon opening the box, I was surprised how small it is. Gave it a test shot and wow ...what a great picture. The box included image transfer and movie editing software. This camera takes photos like my expensive large digital camera and is small enough to carry around like a cell phone. I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a compact camera that great pictures for under $100.

Reviews.Title: Wow.  Nikon.
Reviews.Author: Ray Woodcock
Reviews.Content: I had a very positive reaction upon opening the box.  It is really refreshing to open a product and see the things you'd expect, like a user's manual and a CD.  And then to go to the manufacturer's website and see downloads, FAQs, and more manuals.  Right from the start, I felt like I had really gotten a deal -- like this used to be a $300 camera, and they put the love and attention into it that you'd put into selling a $300 camera.Now, some additional notes, as I got into the website and the camera.The manual didn't tell me where to find my serial number, and neither did the product registration page.  Neither the outside of the box nor the bottom of the camera indicated that the number shown there (which, inspection confirmed, was the same) was the "serial number" OR "S/N."  Oddly, the Nikon product registration page indicated that no manuals or updates were available, when that was obviously not true.I wish electronics manufacturers didn't find it necessary to use proprietary jacks and cables.  That includes this Nikon.  It would be a lot easier to pack for a trip, and there would be less risk of leaving an essential cable at home, if they would all just use the standard mini-USB cable.  One cable would handle everything.I installed the carrying strap, battery, and SDHC memory card.  Mine came with a 4GB class 4 SDHC memory card, but I replaced that with an 8GB class 10.  I had one lying around.  Not sure if that helped.  It didn't hurt.The Nikon website is not well organized.  For instance, I found myself at a page offering the answer to my question.  But I had not asked any questions.  The question being answered was, "Where can I download the latest Nikon software updates?"  That was a good question.  This page did not quite answer it.  It showed 20 different updates, with no indication of which, if any, applied to my particular camera.  Apparently I was supposed to load the included CD first, see what was on it, and infer that the only software applicable to me was whatever would be on the CD.  But even then, no dates were supplied:  I didn't see how I could tell whether the website's offerings were more recent than those on the CD.Starting with the CD, I looked first at the proffered ViewNX2 software.  I wasn't sure I needed it.  I had prior experience with unnecessary camera software.  I already had image editors I liked.  I figured out that the included recharger was just a transformer, from 120V AC to the USB input needed by the camera, so I put that part back in the box and just ran the USB cable directly from the computer to the camera.  As soon as I connected that, the camera turned on and let me set date and time.  I also got a dialog on the computer, offering to let me browse or import pictures, etc.  So I held off on installing ViewNX2 for now.That meant I didn't download any other updates.  There was one possible exception.  Somehow I found a webpage indicating that there was a firmware update for my camera.  But it wasn't applicable to Windows 7 nor to 64-bit operating systems.  So it wasn't useful in my case.Meanwhile, now that I had connected the cable, a light on the camera was flashing green.  The manual said this meant it was charging, and it would require 2.5 hours to charge a fully exhausted battery, and then the light would turn off.Other than that, I didn't go through the manual in detail at this point.  There was too much to learn.  Some of it was familiar from my previous camera; some was not.  It seemed more efficient to check back as I came up against specific questions.After charging the camera, I took some photos.  Excellent quality.  My previous camera was slow -- I would take a picture and then have to wait a couple of seconds before it was done saving it.  That was not an issue here.  (The SDHC card was the same one as in the previous camera.)  It saved the photos within, I think, less than a second.That was as far as I got at this point.  So far, I really like this little camera.Update, Dec. 1, 2013.  This camera has been good for me for 11 months now.  I wish it were easier to hold and use one-handed; sometimes I use it to take pictures of items indoors without a flash, and am holding a light in the other hand.  Also, for some reason, it is not transferring via cable; I have to pop out the memory card and put it into the computer each time I want to transfer pictures.  Not sure if that's a camera issue or a computer issue.  There are also times when I think it could do a better job of identifying the object of attention, in medium to low-light conditions, so as to bump up its shutter speed and avoid blurring.  Still glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Sleek look, bad performance
Reviews.Author: Mickey Mouse
Reviews.Content: The camera looks sleek and nice, but performance is terrible. Very, very, very, very slow in capturing the picture when you push the button. You have to be really still to get a decent quality picture. Not impressed with such a product from Nikon. Returned it back to Amazon within a week. Easy process to return to Amazon and quick refund.

Reviews.Title: disappointed.
Reviews.Author: NatureNics
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a birthday present and started using it today. I am highly disappointed. My last two cameras were Canons (A540 and SD1200 IS Powershots) and I'm definitely returning this for another Canon. I tried the different settings to take some macro shots and the resolution was poor in every lighting that I tried. I am highly disappointed. I am an advanced amateur photographer and I take a lot of macro and nature photos. I do not recommend this to anyone interested in taking close-up pictures.I will admit that the light-weight design and color are awesome! Just isn't helpful if the image quality is terrible.

Reviews.Title: Bad camera and Nikon has the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER
Reviews.Author: pokey
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. If someone gives you one as a gift, exchange it before you're even tempted to open the box.The camera is slow and takes lousy pictures. The screen is horrible. The video is incredibly grainy at any resolution. It is the worst handling camera that I've ever used. It's actually pretty surprising how poorly this thing fits in your hands. It's so awkward to hold that your hands almost always interfere with the camera's operation. Nikon uses a proprietary USB cable for this camera.All of that is almost forgivable at this price-point. It's a cheap camera and I was not expecting anything more. Had the camera actually worked, I would have given it two and a half or three stars. However my camera was also defective, and (repeatedly) trying to deal with Nikon's "repair" center has convinced me that Nikon is not a company that I want to do business with.My camera would not recharge its battery. The charging light comes on, but the battery does not charge. I tried a different charger, charging cable and even a different battery. None of this worked of course, because the camera is defective. So we sent the camera to Nikon for warranty repair. They had the camera for about four weeks, and sent it back to me without repairing it. The "repair" slip said that they had fully tested the camera, and found no trouble with it, so they sent it back as is. Obviously the camera still doesn't work.I called Nikon's repair center number which I found on their website, and explained my situation to their rep. I have experienced some bad customer service, but Nikon really takes the cake. At different points in the conversation, I was told each of the following things:1. The camera is working fine. The charging light means that it's charging.2. Charging the camera for more than three hours can damage the battery.3. The camera is not charging because I used an "un-approved" brand of SDHC card (Transcend) which corrupted the firmware.4. There are only four "Nikon approved" brands of SD card, and that they can be found in the owner's manual.5. Removing the SD card has fixed the firmware, and it really is charging now that the Transcend brand SD card is out.6. Nikon does not replace defective hardware under any circumstances, but I can send the camera back for further "repair."7. Nikon does not refund defective product under any circumstances, but I can try my luck with the store that I bought the camera at.Let's take this line by line:1. I already told the rep that the light comes on, but that it isn't actually charging the battery. It's easy to tell, because the camera won't turn on even after several hours on the charger.2. This is a blatant lie. Li-Ion batteries require specific circuitry to prevent overcharging. If overcharging ever occurs, it's because the device is defective.3. This line is packed full of BS. A. SDHC cards are an industry standard. If a device accepts SDHC cards, than it accepts ALL SDHC cards. B. Transcend makes great SDHC cards. This particular card has worked, and continues to work flawlessly in every computer and device that it's ever been connected to (including this lousy camera). C. No SDHC card could affect a camera's firmware. Firmware is loaded at boot time, and is not writable from within the device's OS. Changing firmware requires special software, and should even require very strong encryption keys. If any consumer device's firmware was ever discovered to be writable via the SDHC card any respectable manufacturer would issue a recall. D. IF the firmware actually WAS corrupt, then the repair center would have found and should have fixed that.4. If there are only four brands of SDHC card that work with Nikon's cameras, then Nikon's cameras are not standards compliant. This alone (if true) would be reason enough not purchase a product, ESPECIALLY one which is meant to capture special moments. Also this should really be printed on the outside of the packaging, since most people buy media at the same time that they buy a new camera.5. If Nikon has invented a method by which a corrupted firmware can repair itself, then they have achieved a truly monumental feat of technological engineering. I have a VERY hard time believing that they have invented such a game changing technology, and that they chose to introduce it to the world by way of their entry level product.6. If Nikon were able to repair the camera in the first place, I would be writing a very different review. It took them over four weeks to not repair it when they did nothing at all. How long will they have it if they decide to do SOMETHING???7. That was the first and only honest thing that the rep said to me. I will never purchase another Nikon product, and I will take every opportunity to explain to my friends and family why I will not and why they should not.

Reviews.Title: BAD
Reviews.Author: katie
Reviews.Content: Seriously takes awful pics. I bought this for Europe, as I didn't want an expensive one in case it got stolen, however this was a total and complete waste of money. I ended up locking it back in my suitcase and using my iphone which never fails to take amazing photos. Everything is blurring and you need to stand perfectly still to see a clear pic, its not NEARLY as sharp as the iphone. Good luck if you need to ask someone else to take a pic of you and your friends! It will DEFINITELY turn out blurry.Better off taking pics with your smart phone. Sorry Nikon, I hate to give a bad review, but a camera's only job is to take good pics, and you failed big time :(

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I thought it would be better than my fujifilm. Wrong. The picture quality was NOT any better and it was slow at "snapping" pictures. I read the manual front to back to see if I was operating the camera incorrectly but no I was doing it all right and still could not get a good picture. I read the reviews before buying this camera and everyone said how great it was. I was very dissapointed. I'm getting a refund and sticking to my fujifilm. It was a cheap camera but it did a better job.

Reviews.Title: skip it
Reviews.Author: turtle man
Reviews.Content: best thing about my purchase was i bought the warrenty, had it 5 months, took some great pic's then the camera started acking bad. fully charged and you could not turn the flash on, 6.3 gigs free space on an 8 gig card, and the camera changed to 4mp g a and you could not get the setting to go back to 16mp, ruined my family photos at the park, so i returned trying a difffrent brand

Reviews.Title: Great camera but get a SDHC that can keep up and a second battery
Reviews.Author: J. Shields
Reviews.Content: Picture quality:  Special settings worked amazingly well for fireworks and night shots.  Acceptable for dim light.  Really blurry if zoomed in and there was ANY kind of movement (you or target) when you took the picture.Menus:  Fairly intuitive menus that take maybe 5-10 second to navigate--most desired commands are maybe 4 drilldowns.Battery Life:  Purchase a second battery.  I took about 200-300 pictures per day (I worry about quality after the fact) and one battery would last about 6 hours before I had to switch to the other one.  Charging the camera mid-day (mobile charger) did not work at all.Speed:  I did my homework ahead of time.  Purchase a good "Class 10" memory card.  Class is a good indicator of how long it takes to take/write a picture.  My camera was noticeably faster than other's on the trip who had Class 4 and Class 2 cards.  Average wait between pictures was about 5 seconds.  Longest wait was about 10 seconds for firework shots--would have to push the shutter about 5 seconds BEFORE the actual picture I wanted.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: mbp
Reviews.Content: the fact that it comes with it's own rechargeable battery makes it worth the purchase. it takes fair pictures, and the compact size is handy.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Roger Lowden
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife, mainly because it was a Nikon. I was not disappointed, it takes excellent pictures and is  simple to use. Switching from still ti video is a snap with 1 button operation. Battery life seems fine. Recharging is simple and quick. Transferring pictures to a computer is also easy. So far I'm glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Good initial impressions
Reviews.Author: Janos Gereben
Reviews.Content: Size, ease of use, quality of pictures - all is good after light use for about a week.I think it's because of me, not the camera, that I cannot figure out a quick setting for shooting in poor light *without* flash. The "evening" setting activates flash. Any helpful hints?One reason for buying the S3300 was the promise of high light sensitivity, but how to make use of it?

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolpixS3300
Reviews.Author: Rosie
Reviews.Content: Perfect for what I need it for, fits perfectly into my bag for nights out. Takes great pictures and is so easy to use, would definitely recommend it....

Reviews.Title: Not good for fun family shots.
Reviews.Author: Mary Craig
Reviews.Content: Way, way, way, way too SLOW!  I. want to return it. Tried to use it at Christmas with my kids but they were gone or hand turned away before the shutter clicked. Very frustrating to use.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S33000 ~ Disppointing!
Reviews.Author: Krissy76
Reviews.Content: I would call myself an "advanced hobby photographer" and decided on the Nikon Coolpix S3300 due to a $79 deal at one of our local stores. It's technical details and features seemed promising - an upgrade in MP and zoom, compared to my old Canon. But it was a total disappointment in reality! Incredibly slow performance, blurry pictures, auto-flash not reacting properly...After just a couple of pictures it went right back in the box, I am not going to keep this thing.I sure wasn't expecting this poor quality from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Faulty Battery Cover
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: The battery cover for the camera is very fragile and does not lock properly.I've had this problem since the first use and would not recommend it unless you'd like to tape the battery cover shut.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: The picture size is great; it had better be for 16mp. But, unless you're outside in the sun the ISO seems to jump really high and you get a pretty grainy photo. If you're taking pictures to print out as 5x8 or smaller then it's not really a big deal. Otherwise, make sure you have some good lighting if you're planning on blowing up the photo. There's also a pretty mean shutter lag and sometimes the camera doesn't want to take the picture. That really makes my wife mad when we're trying to snap a photo of our 16 month old daughter and we miss that moment because of the delay. I'm sure it has something to do with the default settings but it looks for faces and when it can't find them it starts acting weird. It's not always this way; and for the most part it works well. Just don't buy this camera expecting it to be the best one you've ever owned (unless it's your first).

Reviews.Title: It Works for Awhile
Reviews.Author: Melody
Reviews.Content: Had this not even two years. It works OK. A little slow to take the pictures. Flash doesn't always work when you need it to and you can't make it flash. I have never dropped it either. Now I find out it needs updates? Yes that's right people you have to update this camera. The problem? Battery is "exhausted" and won't charge and the camera no longer reads the the USB cable. So we have to buy a new battery that has some charge on it so we can get the camera to turn on long enough to update it. Then we find out the instructions online to update it aren't accurate and what it tells us to do won't work for the camera. This has been a month long process trying to fix this problem. So Nikon says no problem send it in and we'll fix it for $85. That's the cost of a new one!! Basically it was a mediocre camera for a year and a half and now it is crap and useless. I expected better from NIKON.

Reviews.Title: More Problems than Expected
Reviews.Author: BRIAN LOPEZ
Reviews.Content: I bought and thought Great Focused Pictures ,Until I turned on and Noticed the Lens had a Problem coming Out 75% of the time ,I would have to face down and then turn on it to fall out to be able to use. then one day i charged and went to use and the lens came out but then would not go back in and just battery died that wat and since then has been stiff and stuck.... I wish i would have knew but now just wish it could get fixed!!! Alot of money down the drain!

Reviews.Title: Way too fragile
Reviews.Author: T. Anderson
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera in early July for my wifes trip to europe.  In mid July while sitting in a bus she dropped it from lap to floor.  The drop was about 2 feet.  The unit was so badly damaged that it could not be used.  Lens cover would not close and totally out of focus.  I think it should have been in warranty, but Nikon would only repair it for a cost much higher than a new one.  Get something less fragile.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after only 6 months!
Reviews.Author: punkin
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in Dec/2012 to use for our honeymoon.  In June/2013 it stopped working!  No image at all on the screen.  We lost our receipt so we cannot even return it.  We are really upset about it.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: Nancy L. Mcdaniel
Reviews.Content: Have had two of these, and both failed within 6 months.  The first had a screen that was so distorted that you couldn't see what you were taking a photo of. . . the photos came out OK, but being able to figure out what the camera was shooting was impossible.  The second one had a dead battery after about a month of not using it.  It won't take a charge and is dead.  Before that, however, it was so slow that getting quick shots of anything was not possible. Get a Sony or a Canon or anything else.  Both were a total waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Works great ...!!
Reviews.Author: Nigel
Reviews.Content: Another quality Nikon product...Love the fact that it automatically chooses the mode for different scenes..Love the fact that the battery is rechargeable as well......I wish though that there was a separate dock charger for the battery rather than a USB plug....Its fun to use and pictures are perfect.....

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Haruko
Reviews.Content: This is a great little point and shoot.  I love that it came in pink.  The photos are good quality, but the flash sometimes takes what seems like a long time to warm up.  I've missed several cute cat pics because of it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX S3300
Reviews.Author: Sally
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I bought this camera for our Daughter's Graduation present 3 weeks ago. She absolutely LOVES this camera!!! Great product and great value!!! We are looking to purchase one for ourselves!

Reviews.Title: THE CAMERA IS AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Detective007
Reviews.Content: The camera is perfect!!! It works perfect! The color is the same as in the picture, its very thin  and compact

Reviews.Title: Awesome cheap camera!
Reviews.Author: anonymous book critic
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Walmart because it was the cheapest one they had - I knew nothing about the product at all. I just needed the camera to take some photos for an ad on gumtree. Strictly utilitarian purchase. Fast forward to my trip to Fiji... I have spent the past three days photographing the ocean, skies and flowers - WOW - this little camera took some fabulous photos. I posted them on FB, and someone commented they looked professional - and they do! These pictures could easily be gracing greeting cards or a calendar. Bright, crisp and clear - some of the photos are simply stunning. A big surprise, to be honest. I am wondering if I need an expensive SLR after all?? Hmm...

Reviews.Title: Cute and fun camera
Reviews.Author: MsWethany
Reviews.Content: I got this because I needed a simple camera for taking pics of stuff I make at work. It came with instructions with many languages... just not english. Never fear- it was easy to figure out, just push buttons and see what they do. It would be nice to have a reference, but I can probably find that on the internet if I need it. No biggie. It's purple!

Reviews.Title: On / Off button stopped working 4 months after purchase
Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for my sister. Within around 4 months of purchase, I got word that the on/off button stopped working out of the blue. Allegedly, the camera was not dropped nor was anything spilled on it. After investigating the issue myself, the button indeed no longer works 99 out of 100 times. I was able to get the camera to turn on once but was not able to get it to turn off, necessitating removing the battery. After talking to Nikon customer service, I will be sending it in to get warranty repairs done.Hope any problems that anyone else may have occur within warranty!

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: subwo "Subwo"
Reviews.Content: this is the second camera of this model I have purchased. i accidently broke the first by droppimg it on cement. it does way more than I need it to and is small enough not to get in the way. I like the rechargeable battery and ability to charge via USB conn.  the square trade warranty covered the price of the camera and another two year accidental warranty. no, it isn't purple like my first one buy I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: Terrible PNS
Reviews.Author: S.R.L.
Reviews.Content: Bought this to take on a vacation because my DSLR is too bulky to drag along to most of our destinations. As soon as the camera arrived, I took it out of the packaging, charged it and began just taking random pictures around the house (mostly of my 1 year old and his toys). I could not, for the life of me, get a clear picture. I began changing settings and trying different combinations of settings - all to no avail. I can't even sit on my couch and get a clear picture of my feet propped on my ottoman!  EVERY picture is blurred. I'm just glad I discovered this before I leave on vacation and depended on this camera to capture and save those memories. I'll be returning this... You should not waste your money on this camera. Spend a few extra bucks and get something better than the Nikon COOLPIX S3300!

Reviews.Title: Pretty slow
Reviews.Author: sala
Reviews.Content: I bought this today and it does have its pros and consThe pros are that the quality of the pictures are pretty good, taking a picture of a small lip ring (labret) and it shows every detail. Also another pro is that it is very easy to useThe con is that it is very slow. After taking a picture it takes about 5-10 seconds until you can take another picture. even if you take a picture and want to turn it off it still has this delay.. While it may not seem like much if you are out and can be a real problem and hassle. Im not sure if this is all or just mine.

Reviews.Title: Takes a lot of blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Carmine R Graziano
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera based on price, but it takes a lot of blurry pictures. I've tried adjusting the vibration settings etc but its very difficult to take really clear photos. This could be user error on my part but I haven't had this problem with other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves this!
Reviews.Author: Aunt Mimi
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my mother because her old Nikon finally died.  She absolutely loves this!  It is so user friendly, and she goes on and on about how easy and fun it is to use.  She is in her late 60's and a little technically challenged, so it is a great little camera for someone who does not love gadgets and learning new technology.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S3300
Reviews.Author: Harvey A. Orlick
Reviews.Content: Not the best camera, but OK for the price. It takes too long to recycle, and indoor pictures blur due to motion.

Reviews.Title: Don't move!!
Reviews.Author: C. Gribble "cgribble8"
Reviews.Content: I love the picture quality---if I can hold the camera still.  Even when the camera is just held in your hand it feels slippery and ready to fall to the floor. For every problem there is a solution...I simply attach a small table top tripod and use it as a handle to keep the camera steady!!  I also use a lanyard so that the camera can hang around my neck while at the zoo.  It may look kinda funny with the small tripod but it works.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price
Reviews.Author: Stephen Fairchild
Reviews.Content: For a "steady cam" there is an awful lot of movement.  Otherwise a satisfactory buy for the money paid out.

Reviews.Title: I Love It
Reviews.Author: Dave in LA "Book Lover"
Reviews.Content: This is the smallest camera I've ever handled, yet it has 16 megapixels. It takes nice pix. You have to get used to the tiny size, and not put your fingers in front of the lens, etc.The viewing screen is hard to see in bright daylight, but I think that's true of any camera lacking a viewfinder. On my previous Nikon, I was able to fit a small metal shield around the screen, which helped a lot. I don't think I can do that with this one.

Reviews.Title: Very unsatisfied
Reviews.Author: Book lover
Reviews.Content: This camera was not what I was looking for.  It might have been because the zoom didn't work, but I didn't like the quality of the pictures and couldn't take 10 feet or more pics as the picture came out blurry.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Steven J. Tramontozzi
Reviews.Content: Camera works great, so good that even my parents went out and bought their own. Proved to be a great gift and quality camera for the price. Please note it does not come with a memory card.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: Great camera for regular use by the average occasional photographer.  Would recommend to anyone. Great deal for a present. A+

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Carol Simonds
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is easy to use and takes great pictures...very clear and sharp pictures. It is small and light enough to carry with me in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Raymond Kalita
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my granddaughter since she is the Historian for her Four-H club.  It looks nice and she has taken a lot of pictures with it. One problem I see though is the battery compartment lid seems to be very flimsy.  I hope it doesn't break.

Reviews.Title: Great One step point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Scott D. Dredge
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother who is 61, she has hard time with most things electronic... but she has mastered this one. Great buy and great product. She loves it, so I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Worked great, until... **REVISED*
Reviews.Author: LaNedra J. "LaNedra Gaines"
Reviews.Content: My fiance' was extremely excited to receive his early Christmas gift. I'd previously owned a Nikon Coolpix and loved it. He'd spent the earlier part of the da taking beautiful photos and was impressed with the camera's functions. Until... all of a sudden, he went to take a photo before heading out to dinner and all of the photos started showing very blurry. It even showed blurry just looking into the LCD display. Now, the camera keeps shutting off with a "Lens Error" message on the LCD.Unfortunately, he's now unable to take ANY photos. I feel bad that his Christmas gift was a bust. :-(**revision** After resetting the camera, it has been working fine. He's loving it!!!!

Reviews.Title: COOLPIX S3300
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Grandi
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It's easy to use, fits in my pocket, and takes beautiful pictures.  And the pink makes it very cute!

Reviews.Title: Has major problem focusing
Reviews.Author: E. Y. "Erick"
Reviews.Content: I tried many setting and1 out of three pictures are clear. My 8 year old Canon powershot is far superior. I just wanted a wider lens and I assumed the nikon S3300 could take pictures. I guess not

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: wwhite0011
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the money with lots of bells and whistles. Very good lens and the screen is just big enough

Reviews.Title: Nice and slim camera
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Rubio
Reviews.Content: Camera takes great pictures, but it's a litle bit slow to take continuous shots. Still a great buy for family pictures

Reviews.Title: Extremely poor quality
Reviews.Author: D. Burwick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera back in May of this year to replace my Nikon Coolpix S3000 that I truly enjoyed.  I had it for several years and never had a problem until I dropped it and that was pretty much it. Totally my fault. Since I enjoyed the previous one so much - compact size, great pictures, easy charge, super easy uploading of pics, I figured this updated version of the 3000 would be the perfect fit.  I couldn't have been more wrong. In addition to the pictures not being nearly as good as the previous camera, I have had problems with it not charging or holding a charge since I had it. I charged it last Wed., did not use it at all and when I needed it for a special occasion on Sunday it was dead.  Battery exhausted after 0 use.  It now won't even turn on.  I will be using the Square Deal Warranty I thankfully purchased with this low quality camera. I would absolutely NOT recommend this camera to anyone.  It is NOT the same quality as the previous version.  Now I get to search for a new camera and hope I have better luck.  And I also must see how good that warranty I purchased with this is.........

Reviews.Title: Worst point and shoot ever!
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I have had several Nikon point and shoots over the years, in addition to my DSLR and lenses. I like to have a point and shoot in my pocket a lot of the time, they're small and easy to carry. Previous Nikon pocket cameras have done a great job, and often getting better results than my D70s DSLR. And, let me add I always bought the Nikon model at the low end $100-$150 price range, not the higher priced models.This camera is HORRIBLE. First and foremost, the focus is dreadful. I just used it for a weekend in Telluride and had to discard at least half of my photos, as they were not in focus. Same for an earlier event a month ago. I don't know what this camera is trying to focus on, but NOTHING in the images was in focus.  I had read this on earlier reviews, but ignored it thinking it was user error. It's NOT. I have always been able to pull a pocket camera out and get a nice image no matter where I was. Not with this thing.Next up is the exposure itself. Horrid. I took some outdoor photos, granted in snow, but they were unusable, could not even rescue acceptable images with editing software. Previous models did quite well outside.The flash is also not  very powerful, I've used pocket cameras from Nikon and got good indoor photos at night, not with this thing. The photos are grainy because there simply isn't enough light, and that's assuming they are well-focused, which I've already discussed. Also, the flash is on the same side as the shutter button, so invariably if you ask someone to take a photo, you have to tell them to move the fingers that automatically are place on the front of the camera, but in this case, block the flash.I only gave it one star because I had to. This camera is a total FAIL by Nikon. I know it's a cheapy, but previous cheapies from Nikon did a respectable job to just "get the shot" with a camera I could easily carry in my pocket. It's a bummer I didn't listen to the reviews and bought this. Now, I need to buy another camera, AND add the cost of this one to it, when I should have just bought a better camera from the start.Might be time to spend a few extra bucks and try a Canon Powershot.

Reviews.Title: bad product
Reviews.Author: Fan
Reviews.Content: This camera doesn't meet the expectation. Although ultra-slim, the quality of the pictures is really bad and blurred. Even worse than a small sony camera I got 5 years ago. Consider the sale tax and return shipping charge, would you rather choose a local store like Walmart or Bestbuy for your next purchase (at least no return fee)? I have done a lot of online shopping from Amazon, but completely unsatisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: DISAPPOINTED!
Reviews.Author: Connecticut customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because it had good reviews.  I took very good care of it.  But before a year was up, it flashed a message saying "lens error", and then ceased to work.  That was disappointing enough.  But I figured it was still under warranty.  The Nikon people said we could send it in for repairs, but they required so much documentation that we just gave up. I'll have to purchase another camera. But it won't be a Nikon Coolpix or any Nikon product.  If you do purchase a Nikon camera, make sure you save absolutely all sales records (you'll need originals!) and warranty cards, etc. because they will require you jump through a lot of hoops to qualify for the repair you should be entitled to if you can simply prove you purchased it within the time the camera was still under warranty.  In my opinion, both the camera and Nikon are duds!

Reviews.Title: Small and user friendly digital camera
Reviews.Author: Samantha  Summers "SS"
Reviews.Content: It's very small and great to take everywhere with you.  We also have a Cannon digital camera that took too long for the flash to go off indoors so you missed every shot.  This camera is much faster and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: TOO MANY BLURRY PICTURES, ESPECIALLY INDOORS!
Reviews.Author: K. Kulpinski "kk lady"
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this camera except for one thing - too many pictures come out blurry.  You think you have focused, with the green box when you press halfway down but too many are ,in fact, blurry.  Also, whenever I give this to another person to take a picture with me in it, no matter how much I stress focusing slowly and waiting for box and then pressing the rest of way w/o releasing, their pictures are blurry 9- percent of the time, even outdoors.  I have had too many pictures that I looked forward to turn out blurry.  Even in good light levels outdoors this happens.When they are not blurry they are great!  But I don't know if this is a failure of the camera or it is just way too sensitive to careful focusing with the button or what, but it is very frustrating.  I would not recommend.  I did get a good price for it, but wouldn't buy it again for even less.

Reviews.Title: so-so
Reviews.Author: Diogenes "Urban Architect"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to augment a Kodak V1485, a point and shoot 14megapixel camera.  Kodaks seem to be no more but I had liked whatever color rendition they offered better than Canons I have dealt with and for the price, thought this would be a good possibility.  I'm always doubtful about zoom on these cheap cameras as getting one that follows focus is always iffy, or the first thing to go after some use.  So, when downloaded off the chip this camera gives a large frame size 15.3 x 11.5 approx at 300 dpi.  The old 14 megapixel camera input at 480 dpi and a smaller frame size.  This means that if you want to save the 16 megapixel image to a higher dpi, you have to settle for whatever extrapolation the editing program is going to do and so far I am not seeing a perceptible sharpness improvement to this pictures or any better quality when I have zoomed and cropped, which is the other use for these high megapixel cameras.  But the zoom is there and I needed it because the camera is a much wider angle lens when you open it up, almost a fish-eye. Usually if the zoom doesn't follow focus, I fall back on not zooming and relying on editing the image.  With this camera, I have to edit almost every shot for the fish-eye effect to get rid of the keystoning. also some of the zoom pictures are too fuzzy when zoomed--just not sharp, which tells me that the follow-focus aspect of the zoom already doesn't really work that well.  Still, I do sometimes need a wide angle camera and for the price it wasn't bad.  The color rendering seems to be okay, better than the Canons and there are options when shooting whether to go wth a vibrant color setting; also the iso change option worked fairly well. In many ways the thinking that went into the design was more useful for someone who photographs quite a lot, working with landscapes and buildings primarily.  I may have to fiddle with the focus options to avoid the "find face" feature and see if it improves the quality of the images.  So, I'd say it's serviceable but you won't feel as though you've gotten much bang for that 16 MP but it's short money to try it.

Reviews.Title: A great starter camera
Reviews.Author: William Weeks
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our young daughter. This was basically her first "real" camera. She is pretty good with electronics, but had no problem figuring out how to make it work. It was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: Review of the Nikon COOLPIX S3300
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Pietrcollo
Reviews.Content: I have a small cake business, this camera out did all my expectations, clarity, picture quality & most important, ease of operation! During the holiday we had purchased 2 other cameras, they could not even touch the picture quality of the Nikon COOLPIX!  Thank U for making the purchase so easy & shopping for it just a breeze!Sincerely,Cheryl

Reviews.Title: A great boyfriend proof cramera
Reviews.Author: sam the boyfriend
Reviews.Content: Wow, I just found the camera outside in the yard it had fallen out of my jacket pocket, and it raining all night and this morning so I thought for sure it would be a goner. However my girlfriend, who's camera it really is, picked it up and took another fantastic picture of my super relieved face. IT IS A GREAT LITTLE CAMERA!!You need to get a memory card tho, we got a 16 gig Sony card for 18$ at Walmart.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpi
Reviews.Author: amma
Reviews.Content: Since I dropped my son's camera in the Gulf of Mexico, he was very excited about getting this nicer one.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Photonman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a friend and she really likes it. I also purchased two batteries and a charger as well as a 16 GB card and hard case. It does everything she wants it to do, has easy to understand and fairly intuitive interface / menus and fits well in her purse so its ready at a moments notice. I have many Nikon SLR's and DSLR's so Im partial and quite familiar to Nikon. This camera is a great addition to their line of point and shoot cameras. There is a wealth of extra features should she decide to get deeper into the menus, and if not it still does a great job on auto settings, and just happens to have nikon glass... A good value for your money with a color that fits everyones tastes.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Pam Melancon
Reviews.Content: This is the second Coolpix I purchased on Amazon. The 1st one I dropped and broke. I liked it so much I ordered a second. It came in just a couple of days. I am very happy with this camera and the service I get on Amazon.Pam M.

Reviews.Title: ANALYSIS OF NIKON S3300
Reviews.Author: TALONCRITERIUM
